Tariffs: EU hands Trump a political win to avoid trade chaos
subhead: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump reached an agreement imposing a 15% tariff on most European products imported to the US. The 27 EU member states also committed to purchasing more American oil and gas, and to investing in the country.

title: Israel slightly eases its grip on Gaza
Thailand and Cambodia agree to an 'unconditional' ceasefire
subhead: After five days of clashes which killed at least 36 people and displaced tens of thousands more, Thailand and Cambodia's leaders met in Malaysia, and agreed to a truce 'from 24 hours local time, midnight' on July 28, 2025.

title: France's Maxime Grousset crowned world champion in 50m fly
subhead: The French swimmer became world champion in the event on Sunday for the first time in his career. One year after a disappointing Olympic Games, this victory bodes well for the rest of his week at the World Aquatics Championships in Singapore.

title: K-pop boy band Stray Kids light up Paris with well-oiled show and adoring fans
subhead: The South Korean group performed two concerts at the Stade de France on July 26 and 27, for the French leg of their Dominate World Tour.

title: Gazan city of Khan Yunis is almost completely leveled, satellite images show
subhead: Israel's ground offensive has caused massive destruction in the Gaza Strip. Recent satellite photos show that the Israeli military has nearly completely razed the second-largest city in the Palestinian enclave.

Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
subhead: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

title: Retracing James Baldwin's footsteps in Istanbul, the city that saved his life
subhead: The American author and playwright first set foot in Istanbul in 1961, at the age of 36. Turkey was then alive with an artistic and intellectual effervescence, and for 10 years it became his refuge – a place of celebration and intense literary creation.

title: From AI to the military, the expansion of tech oligarchs' empires
subhead: 'Tech Oligarchs' (6/6). As international tensions mount, Donald Trump's second term has opened the floodgates to a rapid rapprochement between Silicon Valley giants and the US military.
